Job Title: Ark Encounter Housekeeping Specialist Full Time- 47210

Location: Williamstown, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Housekeeping, Janitorial Services, Cleaning Chemicals Knowledge, Floor Cleaning, Window Cleaning, Trash Removal, Floor Machine Operation, Carpet Cleaning, Concrete Cleaning, Event Set-up and Tear Down, Laundry Management, Facility Maintenance, Supply Management, Basic Computer Skills, Driver's License, SDS (Safety Data Sheets) Knowledge

Description:
Receives direction and responsibilities from the Housekeeping Management. Participates in a wide range of housekeeping duties to ensure that every area our staff and guests are exposed to is clean, healthy, and attractive with specific attention to the cleanliness of the whole Creation Museum facility. The Specialist is also responsible for ensuring all Museum set ups and tear downs are covered, including developing methods and procedures to keep up with changing demands and priorities. This position will allow one to impact others through a service mindset centered on making an eternal difference. This position should display our Core Values of SERVE (Serve, Equip, Relate, Value, Engage) when interfacing with both internal and external customers to ensure that the message and mission of Answers in Genesis is portrayed in an effective and *** (redacted due to LinkedIn job post guidelines)-honoring fashion. This position provides opportunities for spiritual, personal, and professional development.

Responsibilities

Promote the mission and standards of Answers in Genesis.Create a SERVE culture environment in all work done.Approach all tasks with a second-mile mindsetPrioritize personal integrity in all interactions and assignmentsPerforms housekeeping and janitorial duties to help maintain high standard of cleanness. Duties include: trash pick-up, dusting furniture, sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, cleaning ceiling vents, cleaning hallways, detail restroom cleaning (private office and public spaces), floor, waxing, window cleaning, etc.Cleaning the bathroom sinks, toilets, floors, mirrors and restock bathroom closets as necessaryCleans staff lunchroom including: wiping down tables, microwaves, refrigerators, and floor care (sweep, mop or scrub)Cleans floors in museum restaurantsCleaning all areas open to the public in museum spacesProcess trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compacterKeeps track janitorial supplies that are usedPolishes all door brass and necessary furniture in conference roomsAssist with set-up and tear down of special events for Guests (applicable to all rooms where events occur)Clean up after high profile meetingsResponsible for tablecloth: upkeep and storageResponsible for all laundry accumulated by housekeeping and accommodations.Responsible for all chairs: upkeep and storageResponsible for pipe and drape set-upsAll Housekeeping Christmas Town needsIdentify and assess key areas for possible improvement, involving facilities maintenanceRoutinely inspects and maintains: main building, outlying restrooms and pavilionsMaintains, secure, clean, organized work areas and storage roomsUses appropriate machinery to clean floors, bathrooms, carpet and concreteAnd all other duties and responsibilities as assigned by management.

Requirements

Must agree with and be able to sign our Statement of FaithMaintains a personal relationship with Jesus ChristRegularly attends a local, Bible-believing churchPhysical exertion requiring standing and walking all day, repeated bending and lifting, ability to lift 40 lbs. or more.Operate a floor scrubber and other cleaning equipment.Knowledge of cleaning chemicals, supplies, and SDS (Safety Data Sheets).Excellent attention to detail.Good communication and time management skills.Must be dependable and adapt to changing work priorities and flexible work hours.Must have basic computer skillsCandidate must have reliable transportation and a current driver’s license with a good driving record

Experience & Education

Any combination of education or job-related experience that provides the required knowledge and abilities to perform tasks.Previous experience performing light maintenance and janitorial services preferred.Experience with floor machines preferredParticipates in all relevant training and staff meetings

Items Needed for Possible Employment

Completion of on-line application, RequirementsSalvation TestimonyCreation Belief StatementConfirmation of your agreement with the AiG Statement of FaithCompletion of a Background Check and Pre-Employment Drug Screen

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
